content.p: Find the accommodation that's right for you Albion House offers self-catered accommodation situated in the heart of Beeston town centre and close to a range of supermarkets and local amenities. Located a stone’s throw away from University Park Campus and less than a 20-minute walk from West Entrance, it makes for an ideal location for study and leisure. Albion House is home to both undergraduate and postgraduate students, with quieter living flats available upon request. Exciting plans are currently underway for a new, modern Albion social space to be unveiled ahead of September 2024. Each flat has 7 bedrooms which includes a vanity unit, 2 shared bathroom facilities and a recently refurbished kitchen. Accommodation is guaranteed for the first year. See full terms and conditions. Your Residential Experience Team (ResX) is available 7 days a week, from the day you arrive, until the day you leave, to support you to settle and thrive in your new home, and the fantastic community that you will belong to as a student at the University of Nottingham. Helping you make the most of your time in halls we host a range of events from big to small to help you connect with others and enjoy your time in halls. Our events are aimed to help you thrive in halls and develop as a person, learn a new skill or just have some fun. We offer a supportive and non-judgemental wellbeing service for all our hall students. We can help with a wide range of issues and challenges that you are facing. Highlighting the amazing community we are a part of and setting expectations of behaviour across our halls. Albion House has a thriving community of over 160 students. There are two blocks which are divided between undergraduate and postgraduate students, surrounding a central outdoor courtyard area. Beeston town centre has lots of excellent local amenities including a cinema, restaurants, bars, cafés and local shops which are perfect for socialising and meeting up with friends. Travel is easy from Albion House, with excellent transport links in and around the city centre, by bus or tram. The residence also benefits from a nearby train station meaning that travelling back home is never too far away! Parking is available at this hall and is free of charge. The University of Nottingham is the place for Sports, being Sports University of the Year 2024. So why not add a Sports and Fitness Membership to your accommodation? Whether you want to gym, swim, climb or join one of our sports clubs - our student sport and fitness membership has got you covered. With so much on offer, we give you the power to shape your own fitness and lifestyle journey. Students can use all three of our facilities at David Ross Sports Village, Jubilee Sports Centre or Sutton Bonington and over 80+ University gyms around the country when they head home. All yours, all on campus. Albion House is located in Beeston which is approximately a 20-minute walk from University Park Campus. Beeston has great amenities with good transport links to the city centre, all 3 university campuses and Nottingham train station. The bus and tram stops are a short five-minute walk from Albion House. To finalise your offer you will be required to read and accept a licence/tenancy agreement and terms and conditions from your accommodation provider UPP Broadgate Park. We highly recommend that you read this along with a parent, guardian, carer, or school representative, as this is a legally binding document. You will be accepting liability for the full tenancy length of 44 weeks a year for undergraduates, or 51 weeks a year for postgraduates, including vacation periods. Once you have moved in you are liable to pay for the duration of your licence period. The University will take payments only and are not legally able to influence contractual issues.
